mods.abstract: Notice. TAKEN up in the Choctaw Nation, on or about the 1st of February, 1864, by the Choctaw Indians, and left with me for safe keeping, the following named negroes: One man HENRY, about six feet high, weighs 175 pounds, black and about 23 years olf. Also one girl ANN, copper color, 18 years old, and weighs about 120 pounds. Said negroes say they belong to John Jumber, Clairborne Parish, La. The owner will come forward, prove property, pay charges and take them away. F.A. Rector Mah. & Q.M. Quartermaster's Office, Doaksville, C.N., March 1st, 1864 [m15-5t
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
